alert.note: Alert for Pontotoc (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 17 at 10:34PM CST until December 19 at 12:16PM CST by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM CST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Pontotoc County * WHEN...Until 1230 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1032 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen earlier this evening. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ada, Byng, Allen, Roff, Francis and Fitzhugh. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
